Kasiraja and Shaibya were pleased with Yudhisthira They came together with the two axes, O lord of the earth.
Akshauhini and the mighty Yajnasena Draupadi had sons, heroes, Shikhandi and Chaparajita
Dhrishtadyumna and the invincible, the best of all armed men Samastakshauhinipala yajvano bhuridakshinah All of them were armed with weapons and all brave men
The fish, the best of the righteous, looked at them. He was pleased and gave her daughter to her in the month of Abhimanyave
Then the earthly kings returned There came Vāsudeva, the forest garland, Halayudha. Kritavarma, heartfelt, Yuyudhana and Satyaki
Anadhrishti and Cruel Samba and Nishatha Abhimanyu Upadaya Saha Matra Parantapah
Indrasena and others with their well-concentrated chariots They all came together and lived for a year
Ten thousand serpents and one hundred thousand horses The chariot of the chariots is full of the length of the infantry
The Vrishnis and the many bhojas are the most powerful They followed the tiger of Vrishni, Vasudeva, the great light.
Krishna gave the Paribarha to the great Pandavas Women, gems, clothes, separately, several times Then the marriage was observed according to the law of Matsya and Partha.
Then the conches and the drums and the cow-faced and the hypocrisy They led the fish in the house of the Parthians combined with the Parthians
They killed the deer and the animals with hundreds of animals suramaireya panas abundantly attacked
Singing narratives and actors and Vaitalikas They praised them and the charioteers with the Magadhas

verse_data: सुदेष्णां च पुरस्कृत्य मत्स्यानां च वरस्त्रियः

verse_translation.google_trans: Sudeshna and the best of the fishes in front of the fish They came to the beautiful and all-pervading beautiful gem earrings
Those women who are characterized by colors are beautifully decorated All of them became dark in form, fame and beauty
The family of the family was decorated with the princess They stood in the rewards of Mahendra as if they were their daughters
Kaunteya took her back for the sake of his son Dhananjaya Saubhadra's infallible limbs then in the daughter of Virata
There the great king stood there holding the form of Indra Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti, took her daughter-in-law.

verse_data: प्रतिगृह्य च तां पार्थः पुरस्कृत्य जनार्दनम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Partha received her and Janardana in front of her He married the great Saubhadras

verse_data: द्वे च नागशते मुख्ये प्रादाद्बहु धनं तदा

verse_translation.google_trans: He gave him seven thousand horses and winds and two hundred serpents, he gave many wealth then.

verse_data: कृते विवाहे तु तदा धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः

verse_translation.google_trans: But in the marriage, Yudhisthira, the son of Dharma, was then The Acyuta gave the wealth to the Brahmins.

verse_data: भूषणानि च मुख्यानि यानानि शयनानि च

verse_translation.google_trans: Thousands of cows and gems and various kinds of clothes Ornaments and main vehicles and beds
That great festival is covered with joy and nourishment The city of the king of fish shone, O best of the Bharatas.
